page.title: 03Wildlife
page.content: Mammals: Rabbits are common in this area.The population constantly changing due to myxmatosis which decimates the population periodically. Hares are also present in small numbers. Hedgehogs were introduced to Shetland in 1860 and are now quite common. Otters are natives of the islands and they are relatively common here. The stoat is an introduced animal,the first record is from 1680. Grey and common seals are frequent visitors in Aith Voe. Birds: There are a large number of birds live in or visit this area ,many of them seabirds such as artic terns, blackbacked gulls, etc. Among the other birds are ravens, starlings, blackbirds,redshanks etc. During the spring and autumn there are always a large number of migrating birds.
